thread.title: Eagles make statement, leave "Redskins" name out of media guide
thread.title_full: Eagles make statement, leave "Redskins" name out of media guide

title: Eagles make statement, leave "Redskins" name out of media guide
text:
Eagles make statement, leave "Redskins" name out of media guide The Philadelphia Eagles left the "Redskins" name out of their media guide for Sunday's game. Post to Facebook Eagles make statement, leave "Redskins" name out of media guide The Philadelphia Eagles left the "Redskins" name out of their media guide for Sunday's game.  //on.wusa9.com/1FFEVmR   Join the Conversation To   Eagles make statement, leave "Redskins" name out of media guide WUSA 9 Staff, WUSA 5:14 p.m. EDT September 30, 2015 The Philadelphia Eagles left the "Redskins" nickname out of their media guide for Sunday's game. (Photo: Matt Lombardo, Twitter) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
PHILADELPHIA (WUSA9) -- The Philadelphia Eagles made a statement with their media guide ahead of Sunday's game against the Redskins. 
The Eagles left out "Redskins" from the text enclosed in the guide, referring to the 'Skins solely as "Washington" throughout the copy. 
The Philadelphia Eagles left the "Redskins" nickname out of their media guides for Sunday's game against Washington. (Photo: Matt Lombardo, Twitter) 
The Philadelphia Eagles left the "Redskins" nickname out of their media guides for Sunday's game against Washington. (Photo: Matt Lombardo, Twitter) 
As seen in the above photos, the Eagles used other team nicknames such as "Falcons" and "Jets", but did not refer to the "Redskins" by their name, using Washington instead. Matt Lombardo first tweeted the pictures of the media guides. 
The stance the Eagles are taking is in direct reference to the Redskins' name change debate, which has gained national attention over the past few years with many calling for Washington's team to change their nickname due to racial concerns. 
Like this story? Like WUSA9 on Facebook .
